00036 typedef enum {ROTARY_TOOL,TURNING_TOOL, UNDEFINED} TOOLTYPE;
00037 class tool {
00038   public:
00039     const TopoDS_Wire& getProfile() const {assert (validProfile);return profile;};
00040     TOOLTYPE getType() const {return type;};
00041     bool isValid() const {return validProfile;};
00042   protected:
00043     tool();
00044     bool validProfile;
00045     bool bruteForceOnly; //for creating solid. FIXME:would it make more sense in another class?
00047     TopoDS_Wire profile;
00048     TOOLTYPE type;
00049 };
00050 
00056 typedef enum { BALLNOSE, CYLINDRICAL, TOROIDAL, ENGRAVING, TAPERED, OTHER, UNDEF } SHAPE_TYPE;
00057 class millTool: public tool {
00058   public:
00059     SHAPE_TYPE getShape() const {return shape;};
00060     virtual const TopoDS_Shape& get3d();
00061     double Dia() {return dia;};
00062     double Len() {return len;};
00063   protected:
00064     millTool();
00065     SHAPE_TYPE shape;
00066     double dia,len; //diameter, length
00067     bool validSolid; //true if the solid is valid
00068     TopoDS_Shape myShape; //it's solid, but not always of type TopoDS_Solid
00069 };
00070 
00076 class aptTool: public millTool {
00077   public:
00078     aptTool(double dd,double aa,double bb,
00079             degrees AA,degrees BB, double ll);
00080   private:
00081     double a,b; //d and l are in millTool
00082     degrees A,B;
00083 };
00084 
00090 class ballnoseTool: public millTool {
00091   public:
00092     const TopoDS_Shape& get3d();
00093     ballnoseTool(double diameter, double length);
00094 };
00099 class cylindricalTool: public millTool {
00100   public:
00101     const TopoDS_Shape& get3d();
00102     cylindricalTool(double diameter, double length);

00110 class latheTool: public tool {
00111   public:
00112     latheTool();
